titleStmt.title: John Quincy Adams Diary Digital Project

div.p: 23. C. Jones— Demarara. G. Hay— Newburgh Letters— P.U.S. home. Despatches from Rush, and Forsyth. Copy of Middleton’s Treaty— Diplomatics in Spain— Calhoun at the Office. Eve at Frye’s— Force here— Last sheet revised—
24. VI:30. Hadfield— Lady Lyttelton’s legacy £1500— Calhoun— Rush’s Letter

Slaves— Average value— E. J. Lee— His claim— J. Hellen— Office— Roberdeau. Duane’s Letters— Bailey— At P.U.S. about G. W. Erving— Opinion upon the Compensations— South-American Missions— Temper of Congress— Calhoun there. At Metropolis Bank— Chess with W. S. S.
25. VI— Bailey— S. Hunt’s Letter— Judson’s— O’Brien’s— Roberdeau— B. O. Tyler—to borrow— Stackelberg at the Office— Consular Exequatur forMr and Mrs Cutts here this eve—

26. V:30. By Candle-light. Letter to John— Diary 20 July— Baron Plettenberg. of Munster— Briggs off— T. Cook— Force— The Book— Jessup— S. H. Smith and Bayard from Georgia— C. A. Rodney at the Office. Reily for Acapulco. Warner. Havanna. P. S. Duponceau’s Letter to J. Mason— Sanchez— Cuba. Mrs Thornton here at Eve— Chess.
27. V:45. Rain— Note from P.U.S. Despatch from Rush— Londonderry. Cabinet Meeting— J. Mason at P.U.S— Calhoun— Cuba— Sanchez. Wirt unwell. Meeting adjourned— J. Hellen ill with a fever.
28. VI: At P.U.S— Wirt unwell. Meeting deferr’d till Monday— President’s opinion— Going Tuesday for Albemarle— Frye here. Walk with him—
29. VI. Papers from P.U.S— Spence, Cyane. Porto-Rico—left at Calhoun’s. Heard Little A.M. Romans 11.7. Predestination. Universal Salvation. Evening walk with W. S. S. and George to Frye’s.

30. VI: G. Hadfield here— Power to Rush— Holley with his family. Stackelberg— Norwegian Vessels— Exequatur— A. Mitchell. Cabinet Meeting Wirt and Calhoun— Cuba— Sanchez— To be answered negatively— Calhoun for dissuading—calling for his authority— Proposing to Congress— Evening walk. Chess with W. S. S.
